function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reduced hours and restricted services in the dining industry, including food trucks, may have increased congestion and close interactions among customers during peak hours, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Reliance on social media for communication may lead to misinformation or incomplete information being shared with customers.","category":"Disinformation and Misinformation","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited presence on social media platforms may result in decreased visibility and communication with customers.","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Interpretation and theory building process may lead to biases or misinterpretations in the proposed framework of service ecosystemic value co-creation.","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Close proximity of food trucks at local events increases the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Service encounters as a focal element in service provision","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Servicescapes as the environments for service encounters","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Study of the contexts in which service provision takes place","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Focus on food trucks as a research context","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on data from food truck practices","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emphasis on resilience during environmental uncertainty","category":"Vulnerability risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of communication and transparency about pandemic-related changes","category":"Communication and Messaging","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited research on food trucks and mobile vendors in the context of pandemic response","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased popularity of food trucks leading to higher consumer exposure to different cuisines","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited ability and willingness of consumers to continue social dining experiences","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in product and service production","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of respect for local traditions and landscape","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social activities such as mingas can lead to postponement of work and affect the rhythm of community life","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in hr organization in the ’new normal’ can lead to challenges in implementing health and safety protocols for employees and visitors.","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ecotourism bringing people from different parts of the world to indigenous communities","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of empathy and understanding from leaders towards employees’ work-life balance concerns","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Mental health challenges due to pandemic-related emotional impact","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Partially addressed indicators in personal comfort and local services categories","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to outdoor spaces and greenery","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased demand for urban green spaces may lead to overcrowding and insufficient social distancing measures in parks.","category":"Physical activity and mobility","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ugs serving as centers of public gathering can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased importance of green spaces and ugs as places of refuge during the pandemic may lead to overcrowding and congestion in these areas, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on ugs for respite and isolation can lead to non-compliance with public health guidelines and riskier behavior in these areas.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dichotomy in access to green spaces resulting in localized or long-distance travel","category":"Access to infrastructure  ","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Impact on mental health and well-being due to reduced access to ugs","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unverified anticipated outcomes may lead to inaccurate conclusions","category":"Misinformation and Media Risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited representation of conservation settings and cultures in case study selection","category":"Cultural and Lifestyle Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vulnerabilities in social and economic models supporting conservation efforts","category":"Social Justice Concerns","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited empirical work on covid-19 and entrepreneurship","category":"Occupational and Employment Risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density housing and communal spaces can lead to a concentration of residents and increased flow of people, which can contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate access to open air spaces leading to confinement-related mental health issues in isolated occupants.","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to observe social distancing guidelines in communal spaces, leading to potential transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Socialising in residential spaces may expose occupants to pathogens carried by visitors, including asymptomatic individuals with covid-19.","category":"Health Behaviors and Compliance","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effects of lockdown on individuals’ perception and behavioral adjustment.","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effect of home confinement on psychological health outcomes.","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of virtual reality may lead to reduced physical interaction, affecting the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Social and Psychological Effects ","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Perceived status changes between rounds","category":"Mental and Emotional Wellbeing","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Collecting survey responses during the covid-19 pandemic may introduce bias due to the impact of the
